title: R3001 - Check that the package file is created with the latest version of Publishing Tools.
custom_steps:
1. Unzip the psvita-pkg-******_submission_materials.zip file that was created by Publishing Tools
2. Check "[Debug] Program : Publishing Tools ver.X.XX" in the verify.log file included in the .zip file
custom_expected:
The version shown in "[Debug] Program : Publishing Tools ver.X.XX" is the latest version shown on the
PlayStation®Vita Developer Network website page ( https://psvita.scedev.net/docs/master_submission ).

title: R3167 - The VC-VC configuration is not used as a package configuration
custom_preconds:
The VC-VC package configuration where save data, patches, and additional contents are saved on a
PlayStation®Vita card can no longer be used; the package configuration that can be used by applications
will be unified to the VC-MC configuration. Refer to the following Technical Notes for details regarding
this requirement.
custom_steps:
(1) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(2) In edit mode, tap "Application" > "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" > "#000(app)" and check the
"Storage Type=" value
custom_expected:
The storage type is not "Storage Type = VC-VC (VC-VC/MC-MC or VC-VC/No MC)".

Note from Joe Rice - 3.21.2016
So it looks like that setting is indeed made in the package generator project file for the initial (non-patch) project.
Ours was set to: /quote [No VC/MC-MC]
This application is NOT distributed by PS Vita card(VC).
This application is distributed by network and installed onto memory card(MC).

[No VC/MC-MC]
This application is NOT distributed by PS Vita card(VC).
This application is distributed by network and installed onto memory card(MC).
AFAICT
Given the app was never distributed on a VC it seems likely it wouldn't apply.

title: R3002A - Check that the service ID issued via PlayStation®Vita Developer Network Website is set for the service ID part of the content ID specified during package creation
custom_preconds:
Tester has access to Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita 

NOTE: "Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita (psp2pubchk.exe)" is part of "Publishing Tools" and it is available
to download from "SDK Manager for PlayStation®Vita"
custom_steps:
(1) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(2) Tap "Application" > "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" > "#000(app)" in edit mode and check the service
ID portion of "CONTENT_ID ="
CONTENT_ID can also be checked with the following procedures.
(1) Boot the Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita (psp2pubchk.exe)
(2) Drag and drop the application package into the Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita
(psp2pubchk.exe)
(3) Check the service ID part of "Content ID:"
custom_expected: The service ID issued via PlayStation®Vita Developer Network Website has been set.

title: R3002B - Confirm that the content ID of the patch package matches the content ID of the application to which the patch will be applied
custom_preconds: Required for Patch Submission only
custom_steps:
(1) Install the patch
(2) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(3) Tap "Application" > "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" in edit mode
(4) Tap "#000(app )" and check the "CONTENT_ID="
(5) Tap "#001(patch ) and check the "CONTENT_ID="
(6) Compare the "CONTENT_ID=" in "#001(patch)" with the "CONTENT_ID=" in the "#000(app)"
custom_expected: The content ID matches the content ID of the application.

title: R3004 - Check that the value set for the application version (APP_VER) is greater than that of previous releases of that application or patch packages for that application
custom_steps:
(1) Install the patch
(2) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(3) Tap "Application" in edit mode
(4) Tap "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" > "#001(patch)" and check the "APP_VER=" value
APP_VER can also be checked with following procedures.
(1) Boot the Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita (psp2pubchk.exe)
(2) Drag and drop the patch package into the Package Checker for PlayStation®Vita (psp2pubchk.exe)
(3) Check "App/Patch Version:"
custom_expected:
The value set for APP_VER is greater than the value of that application or patch packages for that
application previously released.

title: R3005  - Parental Control Value
custom_preconds:
For the Parental Lock Level, the parental control level applicable to the application's target
license area is correctly set. For patches, use the same parental control level as set in the original
application.
custom_steps:
Overview
Confirm that the value is set according to the parental lock level (viewing age restriction) rating for the
license region.
Procedures
(1) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(2) Tap "Application" > "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" > "#000(app)" in edit mode and check
"PARENTAL_LEVEL="

* When checking on the PlayStation®Vita system, step (2) is also done by tapping "Information" to display
Parental Controls.
custom_expected:
The value is set according to the parental lock level (viewing age restriction) rating for the license region.

title: R3008 - Check DRM Type
custom_preconds:
Check that the DRM type of a product version is "Free" 

NOTE: NHL.tv DRM=LOCAL and that is OK, waived by Sony as this was the original value from NueLion's App
custom_steps:
(1) Touch the home screen (touchscreen) for approximately 3 seconds to enter edit mode
(2) Tap "Application" > "★Debug Utility" > "★ Check" > "#000(app)" in edit mode and check the "DRM
type=" value.
custom_expected:
DRM type is set to "Free"

NOTE: NHL.tv DRM=LOCAL and that is OK, waived by Sony as this was the original value from NueLion's App

title: R3017 - Confirm title runs when set to RELEASE MODE
custom_preconds: When checking with a Development Kit, tap "Settings" > "★Debug Settings" > "Boot Parameters" and set "Release Check Mode" to "Release Mode" before checking.
custom_steps:
Overview
Using the Testing Kit, check that the features implemented in the application work as intended.
Procedures
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Check throughout the entire application
custom_expected: Implemented features run as intended.

title: R3018 - Check PS button screen transitions and Standby mode
custom_preconds:
Requirement: The application operates as follows:

• When the PS button is pressed while the application is running, the screen transitions to the LiveArea™ screen
• The paused application is resumed by tapping the gate on the LiveArea™ screen

• When the power button is pressed for two seconds or less while the application is running, a
transition is made to the standby mode

• After transitioning to the standby mode, returning to the application screen is possible by holding the
power button for 2 seconds or less or by pressing the PS button and peeling the start screen
custom_steps: _Pass after checking R3018A - R3018D

title: R3018A
custom_preconds: Confirm that a transition to LiveArea™ is performed when the PS button is pressed and released while the application is running.
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Press and release the PS button while the application is running
custom_expected: The system transitions to LiveArea™.

title: R3018B
custom_preconds: Confirm that a paused application starts when the gate in LiveArea™ is tapped
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Press and release the PS button to return to LiveArea™
(3) Tap "gate" ("Continue")

Notes
When a paused application is started, network disconnection may occur after a successful resume even if
the network was connected before the pause. Confirm that error handling (such as attempting
reconnection to the network or displaying an appropriate error message) is performed
custom_expected: A paused application starts.

title: R3018C
custom_preconds:
Confirm that a transition is made to the standby mode when the power button is pressed and released
within two seconds while the application is running.
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Press the power button for 2 seconds or less when the application is running

Notes
The standby mode denotes form the screen blackout occurs until the PS button starts flashing
custom_expected: The application enters the standby mode.

title: R3018D
custom_preconds:
Overview
Confirm that the application resumes after the standby mode is released.
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Press the power button for 2 seconds or less when the application is running
(3) Press the power button and release it within two seconds or press the PS button to release the standby mode, then peel the start screen

Notes
• The standby mode denotes form the screen blackout occurs until the PS button starts flashing.
• When an application resumes from standby mode, network disconnection may occur after a successful resume even if the network was connected. Confirm that error handling (such as attempting reconnection to the network or displaying an error message) is performed
custom_expected: The application resumes.

title: R3019 - Confirm application displays progress bar or animation on loading screens
custom_preconds:
*Testing Note: Only initial app launch displays a loading screen. All other loads are the stream loads SEE R3020)* 

Confirm that an animation is displayed if the loading time exceeds 30 seconds, and progress information
such as a progress bar or the remaining time is displayed if it exceeds 60 seconds.
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Proceed to a point where read processing is performed
custom_expected:
• An animation is displayed when loading exceeds 30 seconds.
• Progress information such as a progress bar or the remaining time is displayed if 60 seconds is
exceeded.

Notes
• Check all points where read processing is performed such as when the application boots, or switching chapters/stages/modes.
• If progress information such as a progress bar or the remaining time is not displayed for loading that exceeds 60 seconds (even if the loading can be canceled), it will be a violation of this requirement.

title: R3020 - The app does not display blank, suspended, or unresponsive screens for longer than 30 seconds
custom_preconds:
Check that the state of blacked out, suspended, or unresponsive screens do not last longer than 30
seconds.


• "Blank screen": A state in which there are no visual/audio cues to indicate that there is a game in progress
• "Suspended screen": A screen in which the displayed image does not change
• "Unresponsive screen": A state in which there is no response to user operation. This does not include demonstrations, or movies and conversation scenes that are included as part of the game's narrative.

Loading screens defined in  R3019 are also not included in the definition of an unresponsive screen
custom_steps:
(1) Tap the home screen's "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™
(2) Go to the location where the screen becomes blacked out, suspended, or unresponsive

Notes
Check all the locations where the screen becomes blacked out, suspended, or unresponsive.
custom_expected:
The application does not display blacked out, suspended, or unresponsive screens for longer than 30
seconds.

title: R3024 - ★ Debug Settings" > "Graphics Library (libgxm)" > "Use Debug Version of libgxm for Game"
custom_preconds: Confirm that when the application runs with "Use Debug Version of libgxm for Game" under "★Debug Settings" set to "Enable", the libgxm render functions and texture functions used in precomputation do not return error codes other than SCE_GXM_ERROR_RESERVE_FAILED and SCE_OK.
custom_steps:
In SETTINGS > DEBUG SETTINGS > BOOT PARAMETERS: Release Mode
+ SETTINGS > DEBUG SETTINGS > SYSTEM > TRC CHECK NOTIFICATIONS Enable

or

(1) Connect a Development Kit (DevKit) to a PC with "Neighborhood for PlayStation®Vita" installed via
a USB cable (mini-B/Type A)
(2) Boot "Neighborhood for PlayStation®Vita" in the PC
(3) Highlight the recognized Development Kit and select "Target Settings" from "Navigate" at the bottom left of
the screen
(4) Select "Refresh" from "Settings Operations" at the bottom left of the screen
(5) Select "Release Check Mode" under "Boot Parameters"
(6) Select "Development Mode" from the pull-down menu displayed on the right side of the screen
(7) Select "TRC Check Notifications" in "System" in "★Debug Settings"
(8) Select "Enable" from the pull-down menu displayed on the right side of the screen
(9) Select "Use Debug Version of libgxm for Game" under "Graphics Library (libgxm)"
(10) Select "Enable" from the pull-down menu displayed on the right side of the screen
(11) Tap "Application" > "gate" in LiveArea™ in the home screen in PlayStation®Vita
(12) Play the application
custom_expected:
System messages other than SCE_GXM_ERROR_RESERVE_FAILED and SCE_OK are not displayed in the upper left of the screen.

GXM: [Function name for which the error occurred]
 - [Hexadecimal error code returned by the function]

title: R3171 - PSTV - If the application can be started on PlayStation®Vita...
custom_preconds:
**MLB ONLY** May soon be eliminated

Before starting this test, make sure Vita is in Development Mode & select PS TV Emulation "ON"
PS Vita path: Settings > (start) debug settings > Boot Parameters:
Release Check Mode = Development Mode 
PS TV Emulation = ON

Connect Dualshock game controller (PS4 recommended for ease of connection) to Vita in PSTV mode via Neighborhood.

When connecting the DUALSHOCK®4 wireless controller to DevKit, carry out the following.
1. Right Click target in Neighborhood & select Pair DUALSHOCK®4
2. Press and hold the SHARE button and PS button of the DUALSHOCK®4 wireless controller until the light bar flashes white.
3. Pairing will then complete
custom_steps:
The following is confirmed after setting "Dolce Emulation" (currently called Playstation TV - Sony Doc is out of date) to "On" and "Release Check
Mode" to "Release Mode" in a Development Kit.
custom_expected:
• The game can be cleared by only using a wireless controller. However, it is not a problem if some
mini-games or certain features cannot be used.

• The application can start with "Resolution" set to any of the following settings: "480p", "720p", or
"1080i".

title: R3172 - Confirm Boot Params correctly set
custom_preconds: Coming Soon - (Star)check
custom_steps:
R3172

TEST | VA VP

Premise: -
Requirement: "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Bootable" or "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Not Bootable" is set for the
parameters for PlayStation®TV in the param.sfo file.
In addition, parameters for PlayStation®TV in a patch package are not changed from "PS Vita:Bootable,
PS TV:Bootable" to "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Not Bootable".


Description
If an application satisfies R3171, select "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Bootable" and enable application startup
on PlayStation®TV. If R3171 cannot be satisfied, select "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Not Bootable" and disable
application startup on PlayStation®TV.
It is possible to change the parameters for PlayStation®TV in a patch package from "PS Vita:Bootable, PS
TV:Not Bootable" to "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Bootable", and it is possible to change "Managed by system
software (selectable only under PS Vita TRC1.5 in SCEE/SCEA regions)" to "PS Vita:Bootable, PS
TV:Bootable".)
Changing "Managed by system software (selectable only under PS Vita TRC1.5 in SCEE/SCEA regions)"
to "PS Vita:Bootable, PS TV:Not Bootable" in the parameters for PlayStation®TV requires the permission
from SCE. Contact Private Support through the PlayStation®Vita Developer Network website (https://
psvita.scedev.net/) in advance before master submission

title: App Icon (Graphics)
custom_preconds: Given the app is installed on the PS Vita
custom_steps: When viewing app icons on PS Vita home screen
custom_expected: Then the app graphics and name of the app display without issue.

title: PlayStation Network Sign in
custom_preconds: Given the app is installed on the PS Vita and user has not signed in to PS Network.
custom_steps: When app is launched from Vita home screen
custom_expected: Then PlayStation Network Sign In prompt displays. User must sign in with a valid PS Network account before the app launch.

title: Launching app via PS Vita home screen
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed

and the user has signed into PlayStation Network account

and the app is not running
custom_steps: When the user taps the app icon
custom_expected:
The user is brought to the Start screen (LiveArea™)

and the app logo displays on the start button displays without issue

and the App Unavailable page does not appear

title: Loading Animation
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed

And the User has logged in to PlayStation Network

And is on the Start screen
custom_steps: When user taps the START button
custom_expected: Splash and loading screen with loading animation appears

title: Debug Logging Off / No Cheats (Submission)
custom_steps:
- Confirm logging has been disabled when system is in Development Mode
- Confirm app behaves as expected in both Development and Release Mode
- Confirm any added Cheats have been disabled

title: Spring Training / Off-season Game Launch
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched
custom_steps:
Spot Check successful Video Launch of a few special case VOD games 

- Any ASG
- Previous Season Playoff Game (if available)
- Previous Season Reg. Game (if available)
- Spring Training games from each Season available
custom_expected: Each type of asset should launch without error. Note that during Spring Training a number of games do not havee archive streams attached, this is expected.

title: Special "Critical Error" Case
custom_preconds: Base install of build has been performed and user account used in test is the logged in account
custom_steps:
COMPUTER STEPS
1. On tester's computer, Login to user account at MLB.com ( http://mlb.mlb.com/home )
2. Go to user profile and make sure no favorites are registered ( https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
3. Visit http://mlb.mlb.com/mediacenter/index.jsp?c_id=mlb
4. Navigate to Game Archives of regular season games and launch any VOD game
5. In Video Player, activate SETTINGS icon and when open check "Hide scores for all games" then SAVE (see attached)

SONY PS STEPS
1. Apply app patch over base build
2. Launch app
3. Without visiting Settings, attempt to launch any game
custom_expected: Game plays back without Critical Error or other issue

title: General Navigation
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched
custom_steps:
Spot Check the following basic Navigation:

- Calendar (nav head to tail of expected limits and spot check a day on each available page)
- Today View Grid
- Day to Day via L1/R1 (include checks into days without games - before and after ASG & in between available Seasons)
- Home Team
- More Vids
- Main Menu Grid
- All Stats and Standings Pages
- Settings
custom_expected: Goal is simply hit all available page types and confirm all can be accessed and nav behaves as expected

title: Settings
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched
custom_steps:
Confirm all buttons can be enabled/disabled 

- Show Scores
- Show Stadium BGs
- Today View Video Tile
- Home Team (enter and switch)
- Pick Favorites (enter and add/remove)

(Login/out check covered elsewhere)

title: Scores On
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched, Show Scores is set to ON
custom_steps:
Spot Check the appearance for the following Show Scores On views and behavior:

- VOD playback including Seek & Event Skipping, Audio Feed Select Swaps
- Live Playback including Seek & Event Skipping, Audio Feed Select Swaps
- Video Tile Plays Video as expected
- Expected Game Tile appearance (scores shown)

title: Show Scores Off
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched, Show Scores is set to OFF
custom_steps:
Spot Check the appearance for the following Show Scores Off views and behavior:

- VOD playback including Seek & Inning Skipping, Audio Feed Select Swaps (no Milestones or event information seen, Game Status hidden, Etc.)
- Live Playback including Seek & Inning Skipping, Audio Feed Select Swaps (no Milestones or event information seen, Game Status hidden, Etc.)
- Video Tile is set to Off, cannot be set to On and does not appear in Today View when Live Games are present
- Expected Game Tile appearance (no scores shown)

title: Audio Player
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched - Live Games Available
custom_steps:
1. Launch an Audio Feed
2. Play/Pause/Play for 1 min+
3. Exit
4. Launch again
custom_expected: Confirm Audio Feed launches & plays as expected

title: Accounts
custom_preconds: Current patch in testing is installed and launched, user not logged in
custom_steps:
Confirm that the following account types log in/out successfully and behave as expected:

- Executive  (all access)
- Premium
- Free (un-entitled)
- Too many usage attempts test account (currently mlbtv+sso@gmail.com / pw = Password1 - good until 2016)

Also attempt to login to:

- Non-existent account
- Good account, bad password
custom_expected: Accounts can be logged in and out without issue from Settings
